content: this legal text summarizes a court case where various requests and exceptions were made by the parties involved the court ruled against the plaintiffs application for division of property and ordered the defendant to remove a canopy that was built in violation of the civil code however the court granted a counterclaim allowing the plaintiff to assign the enjoyment of a specific area to the parties involved the court considered legal principles and cited relevant articles of the civil code the parties were given time limits to file closing statements and reply briefs the court also discussed the interpretation of certain articles of the civil code and made decisions based on the evidence presented the court addressed the costs of the case as well ultimately the court rejected the plaintiffs request for property division ordered the defendant to give up rights to a common courtyard allowed the plaintiff to use a specific uncovered area and ordered the removal of the canopy the plaintiff was also ordered to pay the defendants legal costs the courts decisions were made on august 15 2023 and the case was filed with the secretarys office on august 23 2023
